extension.name: org.apache.nifi.dbcp.DBCPConnectionPool
extension.description: Provides Database Connection Pooling Service. Connections can be asked from pool and returned after usage.

property.name: Database Connection URL
property.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.

property.name: Database Driver Class Name
property.description: Database driver class name

property.name: database-driver-locations
property.description: Comma-separated list of files/folders and/or URLs containing the driver JAR and its dependencies (if any). For example '/var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'

property.name: kerberos-user-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos User Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: kerberos-credentials-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos Credentials Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: kerberos-principal
property.description: The principal to use when specifying the principal and password directly in the processor for authenticating via Kerberos.

property.name: kerberos-password
property.description: The password to use when specifying the principal and password directly in the processor for authenticating via Kerberos.

property.name: Database User
property.description: Database user name

property.name: Password
property.description: The password for the database user

property.name: Max Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or -1 to wait indefinitely.

property.name: Max Total Connections
property.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.

property.name: Validation-query
property.description: Validation query used to validate connections before returning them. When connection is invalid, it gets dropped and new valid connection will be returned. Note!! Using validation might have some performance penalty.

property.name: dbcp-min-idle-conns
property.description: The minimum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool without extra ones being created. Set to or zero to allow no idle connections.

property.name: dbcp-max-idle-conns
property.description: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool without extra ones being released. Set to any negative value to allow unlimited idle connections.

property.name: dbcp-max-conn-lifetime
property.description: The maximum lifetime in milliseconds of a connection. After this time is exceeded the connection will fail the next activation, passivation or validation test. A value of zero or less means the connection has an infinite lifetime.

property.name: dbcp-time-between-eviction-runs
property.description: The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle connection evictor thread. When non-positive, no idle connection evictor thread will be run.

property.name: dbcp-min-evictable-idle-time
property.description: The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction.

property.name: dbcp-soft-min-evictable-idle-time
property.description: The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle connection evictor, with the extra condition that at least a minimum number of idle connections remain in the pool. When the not-soft version of this option is set to a positive value, it is examined first by the idle connection evictor: when idle connections are visited by the evictor, idle time is first compared against it (without considering the number of idle connections in the pool) and then against this soft option, including the minimum idle connections constraint.

dynamicProperty.name: JDBC property name
dynamicProperty.description: JDBC driver property name and value applied to JDBC connections.

dynamicProperty.name: SENSITIVE.JDBC property name
dynamicProperty.description: JDBC driver property name prefixed with 'SENSITIVE.' handled as a sensitive property.

restriction.explanation: Database Driver Location can reference resources over HTTP

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.dbcp.DBCPConnectionPoolLookup
extension.description: Provides a DBCPService that can be used to dynamically select another DBCPService. This service requires an attribute named 'database.name' to be passed in when asking for a connection, and will throw an exception if the attribute is missing. The value of 'database.name' will be used to select the DBCPService that has been registered with that name. This will allow multiple DBCPServices to be defined and registered, and then selected dynamically at runtime by tagging flow files with the appropriate 'database.name' attribute.

dynamicProperty.name: The name to register DBCPService
dynamicProperty.description: If 'database.name' attribute contains the name of the dynamic property, then the DBCPService (registered in the value) will be selected.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.dbcp.HikariCPConnectionPool
extension.description: Provides Database Connection Pooling Service based on HikariCP. Connections can be asked from pool and returned after usage.

property.name: hikaricp-connection-url
property.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.

property.name: hikaricp-driver-classname
property.description: The fully-qualified class name of the JDBC driver. Example: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver

property.name: hikaricp-driver-locations
property.description: Comma-separated list of files/folders and/or URLs containing the driver JAR and its dependencies (if any). For example '/var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'

property.name: hikaricp-kerberos-user-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos User Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: hikaricp-username
property.description: Database user name

property.name: hikaricp-password
property.description: The password for the database user

property.name: hikaricp-max-wait-time
property.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or 0 <time units> to wait indefinitely.

property.name: hikaricp-max-total-conns
property.description: This property controls the maximum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections. Basically this value will determine the maximum number of actual connections to the database backend. A reasonable value for this is best determined by your execution environment. When the pool reaches this size, and no idle connections are available, the service will block for up to connectionTimeout milliseconds before timing out.

property.name: hikaricp-validation-query
property.description: Validation Query used to validate connections before returning them. When connection is invalid, it gets dropped and new valid connection will be returned. NOTE: Using validation might have some performance penalty.

property.name: hikaricp-min-idle-conns
property.description: This property controls the minimum number of idle connections that HikariCP tries to maintain in the pool. If the idle connections dip below this value and total connections in the pool are less than 'Max Total Connections', HikariCP will make a best effort to add additional connections quickly and efficiently. It is recommended that this property to be set equal to 'Max Total Connections'.

property.name: hikaricp-max-conn-lifetime
property.description: The maximum lifetime in milliseconds of a connection. After this time is exceeded the connection will fail the next activation, passivation or validation test. A value of zero or less means the connection has an infinite lifetime.

dynamicProperty.name: JDBC property name
dynamicProperty.description: Specifies a property name and value to be set on the JDBC connection(s). If Expression Language is used, evaluation will be performed upon the controller service being enabled. Note that no flow file input (attributes, e.g.) is available for use in Expression Language constructs for these properties.

restriction.explanation: Database Driver Location can reference resources over HTTP

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.record.sink.db.DatabaseRecordSink
extension.description: Provides a service to write records using a configured database connection.

property.name: db-record-sink-dcbp-service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain a connection to the database for sending records.

property.name: db-record-sink-catalog-name
property.description: The name of the catalog that the statement should update. This may not apply for the database that you are updating. In this case, leave the field empty

property.name: db-record-sink-schema-name
property.description: The name of the schema that the table belongs to. This may not apply for the database that you are updating. In this case, leave the field empty

property.name: db-record-sink-table-name
property.description: The name of the table that the statement should affect.

property.name: db-record-sink-translate-field-names
property.description: If true, the Processor will attempt to translate field names into the appropriate column names for the table specified. If false, the field names must match the column names exactly, or the column will not be updated

property.name: db-record-sink-unmatched-field-behavior
property.description: If an incoming record has a field that does not map to any of the database table's columns, this property specifies how to handle the situation

allowableValue.description: Any field in the document that cannot be mapped to a column in the database is ignored
If the document has any field that cannot be mapped to a column in the database, the FlowFile will be routed to the failure relationship

property.name: db-record-sink-unmatched-column-behavior
property.description: If an incoming record does not have a field mapping for all of the database table's columns, this property specifies how to handle the situation

allowableValue.description: Any column in the database that does not have a field in the document will be assumed to not be required. No notification will be logged
Any column in the database that does not have a field in the document will be assumed to not be required. A warning will be logged
A flow will fail if any column in the database that does not have a field in the document. An error will be logged

property.name: db-record-sink-quoted-identifiers
property.description: Enabling this option will cause all column names to be quoted, allowing you to use reserved words as column names in your tables.

property.name: db-record-sink-quoted-table-identifiers
property.description: Enabling this option will cause the table name to be quoted to support the use of special characters in the table name.

property.name: db-record-sink-query-timeout
property.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL statement , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
